Whats everyone's thoughts on aligning characters across lines in programming. Its not recommended by pep8 (i think) but imo it makes things readable
```myobject = sqrt(x1, x2) / 2
smol     = sqrt(x2, x1) / 2

text: I go back and forth on this.  I think when there is a lot of similarity on the RHS it makes it easier to see the similarity and the differences.  OTOH, subsequent refactoring/rearranging of the code often requires realignment or it looks weird.  (I hope this doesn't devolve into a spaces-vs-tabs debate :sweat_smile:)

text: I hate hate hate it. 0/10.  Especially when there are a number of lines and the gap is relatively large (makes it hard to match up the lhs with rhs). I only do it when I’m forced to write Go since gofmt does it by default.

I think it's pretty.
But I I don't think it's worth it.
The inconsistency when you can't do it right is very ugly.
And like was mentioned it makes your diffs much bigger if you need to change multiple lines just to add one
